channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: At the roundabout there is wild shrubs growing, 31st August
item.description:
The end of dual carriageway were the roundabout there is a over grown shrub the needs to be removed as it’s causing a blind view point when approaching the roundabout., also on Thames Road there is a lot of growth on the kerb side of the road that needs to attended and removed. The road towards leading to the railway arch/ recycling centre the road requires to be clean as sure the road sweeper would be able attend and sweep the area
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped mattress and bed, 31st August
item.description:
Dumped mattress and bed outside Kinsey House (9-16), Lyall Avenue on Friday, 29 August 2025 at approximately 19:15 by mother and presumably her daughter

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lyall Avenue, Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned bike, flytipping and trip hazard, 31st August
item.description:
There is lots of flytipping in Croyland Road along a vast stretch of the road, there is also an abandoned santander electric bike near the Church and a potential trip hazard on the pavement outside number 106 and 108 Croyland Road near the tree.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croyland Road, Edmonton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Small tree on pavement, 31st August
item.description:

item.title: Raised repair making road uneven, 31st August

item.title: Edmeston Close Residents Allowing Climbers to Obstruct Pavement, 31st August
item.description:
This was reported in 17 Aug but at the wrong location. Residents of Edmestone Close are allowing their climbers to completely obstruct the pavement on the Red Path. This is not a new problem, they do it every year.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Edmeston Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bike thrown down stairs has damaged brickwork, 31st August
item.description:
A Lime bike has thrown down the stairs to Mabley and has smashed the brickwork at the corner. (I am not reporting the issue of the bike, I am reporting that the brickwork now needs to be repaired.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hillyfield Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle number plate had been cloned, 31st August
item.description:
Vehicle number plate had been cloned and used to commit a road offence on Saturday August 23 2025 at 16:07. As this is number plate and PCN related issue I have not listed the number plate or uploaded images as this report will be accessed by the public.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Berger Road, Hackney, London

item.title: England flag hung involuntarily outside our house, 31st August
item.description:
England flags are being hung up involuntarily outside our home with what we feel is with racist intent. This makes us very uncomfortable to have visitors and is defacing a public lamp-post. People are entitled to peaceful protest but this kind of action does not signify the views of everyone living on the road and is not fair to see right outside your own home.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Wellington Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gangland graffiti, 31st August
item.description:
Gangland graffiti written along wall near road sign if Mayplace Avenue jw Thames Road Crayford. Been there for two weeks, visible to all.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayplace Avenue, Barnes Cray, London

item.title: General upkeep, 31st August
item.description:
After the Notting Hill Carnival, the pedestrian crossing directional flaps have been pushed making the lights not visible to pedestrians. The carnival attendees also damaged some of the buttons. Some general BAU maintenance is required.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bishop's Bridge Road, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: St George’s flags daubed everywhere, 31st August
item.description:
Flags painted on roundabout… dangerous and illegal. Flags daubed everywhere clearly designed to intimidate. No pride in the country displayed at all. On road signs, bush shelters, telecom boxes. Like a scene from Black Death times.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 451, Downham Way, Downham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
